result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A. Mertz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Order for payment of Atty. Nicole Schrier as appointed defense counsel in the amount of  $719.46
Petition for Payment of Atty Fees

Case called at 10:11 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Defendant Jacob A. Mertz in court with Attorney Nicole Nannette Schrier. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
ADA Hall submits victim impact statement

Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence 3/4/16 by 7:00 pm 
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--Sex offender evaluation (DOC), treatment and follow through with all treatment recommends
--Sex offender Registry pursuant to 973.048(1m)(b) while on probation - termination upon completion of probation
--No possession of any "SmartPhone", computer or other computerized device capable of accessing the internet except for employment purposes as approved by Agent
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Reimburse Attorney fees
--To pay statutory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including DNA surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No contact with victim MRY (3-26-2001) or any other female under the age of 18 years except for biological siblings or biological children
--Letter of apology to MRY as approved by Agent

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Court presents basis and grants expungement upon successful completion of probation
Recess: 10:35 am
The Court orders the defendant to reimburse Jefferson County for Court appointed attorney fees in the amount of $719.68
with attachments and proposed order for payment of court appointed defense counsel fees from Attorney Schrier in the amount of $719.68.
from Bkpg to Judge - Re: Failure to Comply with Court Order regarding AFT payments.

Case called at 1:35 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jacob A. Mertz in court with Attorney Nicole Nannette Schrier. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.
Plea of "Not Guilty" entered
Atty Schrier requests a STC in approximately 2-3 weeks, received discovery just before holidays
ADA Shock: No objection
Court reminds Defendant that bond and conditions of bond remain in effect as case is pending.
Recess: 1:37 pm

NEXT: (1) STC scheduled for 1/28/16 at 1:30 pm - Send notices

Defendant Jacob A. Mertz in court with Attorney Nicole Nannette Schrier.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance
  
Mr.Mertz waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Atty. Schrier files a Writ of Substitution

--The Court directs the Clerk to assign a new Trial Judge

The State submits an Information

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 1:36 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jacob A. Mertz appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Mr. Mertz is not eligible for SPD Services

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; DOB & address confirmed accurate; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No contact with MRY, or MRY's family
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.)
-No unsupervised contact with children
-No use of social media
-No text messaging except to wife
-No access to internet except as needed for employment purposes and banking
Recess: 1:41 pm 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 10/21/15 at 2:40 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 12/4/15 at 10:30 am - Send notices
